item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Blazziin, post:16, topic:356235”][quote author=xldarkwinglx link=topic=452776.msg3318908#msg3318908 date=1282532339]
I don’t see any errors. But one thing that might be helpful to the players and especially mods (cause I see it’s for admins+), is add this to the end of staffzone command. But it before the last } though!

} else {
sM(“You have to be an admin to go here. Modzone coming soon!”);

Only put the modzone if you make one :D. But it’s a great first TuT! I would repp++ cause it is a good first TuT but i can’t
[/quote]

Simply you can change it to admin+ not owner plus or make it Mod+
code:if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“staffzone”) && playerRights >= 0) {
triggerTele(2510, 4718, 0);
sM(“You Teleport to the staff zone, Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury).”);
}

To simply 0=mod+ 1=admin+ 2=co+

I will not be using this because of the other comment saying a couple of rocks banks and shops.
you should have made it abit more descent.[/quote]

Your wrong… >= 0 means normal play and up 1 is mod 2 admin 3 owner 4 hidden admin… and if you weren’t lazy you would put the objects in yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] - How to make a basic staff zone area! - [Delta] NOOB Friendly!
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:13, topic:356235”][quote author=Prnt Screen link=topic=452776.msg3342111#msg3342111 date=1284480697]
[ URL=http://img836.imageshack.us/i/naamloosd.jpg/][/URL]

This is what i get. :S
Some help please?
Very nice btw. I’m hoping to be able to add it
[/quote]

[code=java]
switch (orphaned) {
case 1:
break;

    case 2:
    break;

}
case 3:
break;[/code]

That would be causing the orphaned case error, because it’s outside of a switch statement.

[code=java]switch (fixed) {
case 1:
break;

    case 2:
    break;

    case 3:
    break;

}[/code]

As for your other error remember, you enclose an if condition in parentheses, but you don’t put a semicolon after the condition. If find more than one statement between an if and its else, look for brackets. If the statements between if and else aren’t surrounded by brackets, thats the reason why you are getting the error. (Most likely.)[/quote]

Daammmmmn JAVA MASTER.

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] - How to make a basic staff zone area! - [Delta] NOOB Friendly!

item.title: [Delta] - How to make a basic staff zone area! - [Delta] NOOB Friendly!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Prnt Screen, post:5, topic:356235”][ URL=http://img836.imageshack.us/i/naamloosd.jpg/][/URL]

This is what i get. :S
Some help please?
Very nice btw. I’m hoping to be able to add it :P[/quote]

[code=java]
switch (orphaned) {
case 1:
break;

    case 2:
    break;

}
case 3:
break;[/code]

That would be causing the orphaned case error, because it’s outside of a switch statement.

[code=java]switch (fixed) {
case 1:
break;

    case 2:
    break;

    case 3:
    break;

}[/code]

As for your other error remember, you enclose an if condition in parentheses, but you don’t put a semicolon after the condition. If find more than one statement between an if and its else, look for brackets. If the statements between if and else aren’t surrounded by brackets, thats the reason why you are getting the error. (Most likely.)

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] - How to make a basic staff zone area! - [Delta] NOOB Friendly!
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Prnt Screen, post:5, topic:356235”]

This is what i get. :S
Some help please?
Very nice btw. I’m hoping to be able to add it :P[/quote]

Hmmm, for the else without if error, undo EVERYTHING you did in STEP 4 ONLY! And Redo it (Redo it because I edited it too remove errors)

If you don’t know what to remove because the new Step 4 is there, then here is the old step 4… Remember UNDO EVERYTHING!!! UN-DO Do not follow it.

Part 4: Making a shop go there.

In Client.java Search

WanneShop

a few times, then you should see something like this…

} else if (NPCID == 933) {

Add this to the code

} else if (NPCID == %%%%) { PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 90; // Crafting shop

Fill in

%%%% - with npc id

- with shop id

Then go into autospawn.cfg and right above

[ENDOFSPAWNLIST]

put…

spawn = %%%%	3087	3500	0	0	0	0	0	1

Replace %%%% with the npc id and REMEMBER to tab the spaces yourself! Do not C&P

Now for the last part open shops.cfg and put this in…

shop = 90	Staff_Zone_Shop!! 				2	2	35	1000	667	1000	746	1000	2402	1000	8100	1000	7804	1000	7806	1000	7807	1000	7808	1000	7809	1000	7671	1000	2621	1000	7611	1000	7592	1000	7593	1000	7594	1000	7595	1000	7596	1000	5553	1000	5554	1000	5555	1000	5556	1000	5557	1000	4068	1000	4069	1000	4070	1000	4071	1000	4072	1000	3481	1000	3483	1000	3485	1000	3486	1000	3488	1000	1409	1000	642	1000	652	1000	662	1000	2589	1000

Replace #### with your shop id

and for that other error, I haven’t gotten it in awhile, I don’t remember what it means, try the redoing step 4 thingy and if it stills gives you the error, google it.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] - How to make a basic staff zone area! - [Delta] NOOB Friendly!
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

(My first tutorial so cut me some slack :D)

What you are doing: Creating a BASE staff zone where your admin+ can chill.
Difficulty: 2/10
Knowledge Needed: How to C&P, Follow Instructions, BASIC java coding.
Bases Tested On: Delta
Files Edited: Client.java, Shops.cfg, Autospawn.cfg

Step 1: Creating the command!

Go into Client.java and search up if(command.startsWith("mypos")

You should see something like this:

if(command.startsWith("mypos") && playerRights > 0){ sM("AbsX: "+absX+" AbsY: "+absY+""); } if(command.startsWith("hail") && playerRights > 2){ hail(); } if(command.startsWith("suckit") && playerRights >= 3){ suck(); } if(command.startsWith("pnpc") && playerRights >= 2){ int npc = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5)); if(npc < 2745){ npcId = npc; npcId2 = npc; isNpc = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } if(command.startsWith("unpc") && playerRights >= 2){ isNpc = false; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } if(command.startsWith("combat") && playerRights > 2){ int combat = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7)); extraCb += combat; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Under the } add this…

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("staffzone") && playerRights >= 2) { triggerTele(2510, 4718, 0); sM("You Teleport to the staff zone, Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury)."); }

NOOB explanation

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("staffzone")

If you do ::staffzone…

&& playerRights >= 2) {

And your player rights were 2 and above (admin+), (1 for mod, 2 admin, 3 owner, 4 hidden admin).

triggerTele(2510, 4718, 0);

You would get teled to the x coord 2510, and the y coord 4718, and the height level 0.

sM("You Tele to the staff zone.");

And be sent the message above…

Advanced explanation: This means that in your server, if you did ::staffzone, and you were an admin+, then you would get teled too the coords specified (in this case x:2510 y:4718.) and it would send the message “you tele to the staffzone” to you.

Part 2: Making the Objects

Go into Client.java and and search up…

public void NewObjects() {

You should see something like this…

makeGlobalObject(2974, 3372, 2783, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3353, 2109, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3352, 2109, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3351, 2091, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3350, 2094, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3349, 2093, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3348, 2097, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3347, 2103, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2940, 3346, 2105, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3105, 3498, 3828, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2991, 3379, 2470, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3091, 3506, 10638, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3098, 3506, 6552, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3104, 3503, 410, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2864, 9938, 4755, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2900, 2905, 13180, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2740, 5103, 13181, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2900, 2915, 13179, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2900, 2920, 13184, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2760, 2791, 2560, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2760, 2789, 2565, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2760, 2787, 2562, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2536, 4717, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2536, 4716, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2536, 4715, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2536, 4714, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2536, 4713, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2536, 4712, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(3286, 3211, 2562, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3299, 3199, 4878, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3298, 3199, 4877, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3299, 3200, 4876, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3298, 3205, 2565, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3298, 3202, 2560, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3299, 3310, 2213, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3102, 9307, 2213, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3103, 9307, 2213, 0, 10);

Add this with them…

makeGlobalObject(2514, 4722, 10679, 0, 10); // Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury). makeGlobalObject(2514, 4720, 10686, 0, 10); // Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury). makeGlobalObject(2514, 4718, 10687, 0, 10); // Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury). makeGlobalObject(2514, 4716, 10688, 0, 10); // Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury). makeGlobalObject(2514, 4714, 10689, 0, 10); // Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury).

NOOB explanation:

makeGlobalObject(XCOORD, YCOORD, OBJECTID, FACE, 10);

We basically just added the objects X coords, Y coords, the Object id, the way it’s facing, and at the end a 10.

Part 3: Making the Objects do things

In Client.java look for…

if(objectID == 356){ addItem(223, 1); sM("You find some spider eggs within the box."); }

You should see something like this

if(objectID == 356){ addItem(223, 1); sM("You find some spider eggs within the box."); } if(objectID == 12731){ toX = 3087; toY = 3497; heightLevel = 0; sM("You tele out of fun pk."); } if(objectID == 6551){ triggerTele(3079, 3495, 0); sM("You enter Chaos Wars there is "+PlayerHandler.cwWaitTimer+" left till next game."); } if(objectID == 7272){ triggerTele(3079, 3498, 0); sM("You Leave Chaos Wars."); }

Under the } add this

if(objectID == 10679){ addItem(35, 1); addItem(1077, 1); addItem(1107, 1); addItem(2904, 1); addItem(6570, 1); addItem(3753, 1); addItem(4708, 1); addItem(4712, 1); addItem(4714, 1); addItem(560, 900000); addItem(565, 900000); addItem(555, 900000); addItem(4675, 1); addItem(6889, 1); sM("You Recieve a PK Mage/Worrior Set, Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury)."); } if(objectID == 10686){ addItem(1037, 1); addItem(1038, 1); addItem(1040, 1); addItem(1042, 1); addItem(1044, 1); addItem(1046, 1); addItem(1048, 1); addItem(1050, 1); addItem(1053, 1); addItem(1055, 1); addItem(1057, 1); addItem(4084, 1); addItem(962, 1); sM("You Recieve a phat and mask set, Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury)."); } if(objectID == 10687){ addItem(2653, 1); addItem(2655, 1); addItem(2657, 1); addItem(2659, 1); addItem(2661, 1); addItem(2663, 1); addItem(2665, 1); addItem(2667, 1); addItem(2669, 1); addItem(2671, 1); addItem(2673, 1); addItem(2675, 1); addItem(2623, 1); addItem(2625, 1); addItem(2627, 1); addItem(2629, 1); addItem(2615, 1); addItem(2617, 1); addItem(2619, 1); sM("You recive a God armor set and a (t) and (g) set, Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury)."); } if(objectID == 10688){ addItem(660, 1); addItem(650, 1); addItem(640, 1); addItem(638, 1); addItem(648, 1); addItem(658, 1); sM("You Recieve a 3rd age mage and range set, Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury)."); } if(objectID == 10689){ addItem(4566, 1); addItem(4565, 1); addItem(2476, 1); addItem(2460, 1); addItem(4079, 1); addItem(4037, 1); addItem(4039, 1); addItem(6541, 1); addItem(6059, 1); addItem(773, 1); sM("Fun shit, Made by Zezimo (Clawz fury)."); }

NOOB explanation:

if(objectID == 10689){

If the object id is 10689… and you click the object in the game.

addItem(4566, 1); addItem(4565, 1); addItem(2476, 1); addItem(2460, 1); addItem(4079, 1); addItem(4037, 1); addItem(4039, 1); addItem(6541, 1); addItem(6059, 1); addItem(773, 1);

It will add the specified items in your inventory…(addItem(ITEMID, AMOUNT);

sM("Fun shit.");

And send you the message “Fun shit” (sM(“message”)

}

Ends the code…

Part 4: Making a shop go there.

In Client.java Search

if(NPCID == 545){

then you should see something like this…

if(NPCID == 710){ PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 5; } if(NPCID == 2572){ PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 44; } if(NPCID == 2291){ PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 46; } if(NPCID == 2283){ PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 47; } if(NPCID == 2536){ PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 43; }

Add this under one of the }'s add this.

if(NPCID == ####){ PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 90; }

Fill in the #### with the npc id you want to open up the shop!

NOOB explanation:

if(NPCID == ####){

If the npc id equals the one you specified and you click on the npc in game

PutNPCCoords = true; WanneShop = 90;

He will open up the shopid 90 (We will get to that later in step 4)

Advanced Explanation: We basically made the npc open up the shop.

Now go back to your source file and go into the folder “config” then click “autospawn”
and right above

[ENDOFSPAWNLIST]

put…

spawn = ####	3087	3500	0	0	0	0	0	1

Replace #### with the npc id You put in the first part, and for .cfg files you CANNOT space the numbers you must use the “tab” button too place the numbers for example…

spawn = npcid(tab)3087(tab)3500(tab)0(tab)0(tab)0(tab)0(tab)0(tab)1

NOOB Explanation:

spawn = ####

The npc id you want too spawn

3087	3500

X and Y coords

0

Height level

0	0	0	0

Walking coords

1

Npc type

Advanced Explanation: We basically just spawned the npc to open up shop.

Now for the last part stay in the config folder, open “shops” and and put this in…

shop = 90	Staff_Zone_Shop!! 				2	2	35	1000	667	1000	746	1000	2402	1000	8100	1000	7804	1000	7806	1000	7807	1000	7808	1000	7809	1000	7671	1000	2621	1000	7611	1000	7592	1000	7593	1000	7594	1000	7595	1000	7596	1000	5553	1000	5554	1000	5555	1000	5556	1000	5557	1000	4068	1000	4069	1000	4070	1000	4071	1000	4072	1000	3481	1000	3483	1000	3485	1000	3486	1000	3488	1000	1409	1000	642	1000	652	1000	662	1000	2589	1000

Advanced Explanation: We basically just added the items to go in shop.

This is the same as before, you must tab everything by yourself.

this will take awhile because you have to tab the spaces yourself. :\ but anyways! YOUR DONE! Save, compile, RUNNN!

Please comment on what you think, idc if you leech this as long as you give me creds.

[size=12pt]If your wondering why one of the boxes gives you a “fixed device”, thats a weapon for a quest on my server called future technology etc, it’s supossed to be a cannon, and it on my server when you use it it’s long range, has an exploding gfx, and sound, and much more, I realease the NON-Longrange version on here, simply because I was too lazy to add making it longrange on mopar and I wasn’t in the mood to be flamed by a bunch of douche bags who LIVE on mopar and go spam every single topic, well go check out the topic, look at all my tutorials and you’ll see it, it’s ethier “beginner tutorials” or “various cool tutorials” can’t remember…[/size]
